page.title: 13THE POTTERY IN FELMINGHAM
page.content: Belaugh Pottery in Church Road was opened in 1975, in a building that was originally part of the King's Head Public House (closed in l950). Over the years this building had been put to many uses as diverse as cycle repairs, shoe mending, wedding receptions, and, during the Second World War, Home Guard Training. Today it houses the pottery workshop as well as living accomodation; and produces handthrown stoneware pottery which is sold through outlets in this country and world wide; as well as in the pottery's own shop.
